column3: str

<UIForeground>F201FC</UIForeground><UIGlow>F201FD</UIGlow> Quest Sync<UIGlow>01</UIGlow><UIForeground>01</UIForeground>
The sentry captain fears for the fate of one of his men.
Search for the amaro.
Search for the amaro once again.
Use the healing salve on the wounded sentry.
Report back to the sentry captain.
Damn it all! We can ill afford to lose another─ Ho there, friend. Might you lend me your aid? One of my best men has yet to return from his patrol, and I fear the worst.
As you can see, his amaro made it back safely, but my man's nowhere to be found. Could you search for him in my stead? I would go myself, but I can't very well abandon my post.
(-Amaro-)Gwee, gwee!
Bloody beast! Where do you think you're─ Ah, too late I suppose. But wait... Do you reckon he's gone back for his rider?
Sorry to trouble you, friend, but do you think you could follow that amaro for us? That scaly brute might be my best chance at finding our man.
And take this salve with you. I reckon there's a good chance he's out there, too wounded to have made his way back.
Pray follow that amaro, friend! That beast might be our best hope to track down my missing man.
The amaro stares intently in the general direction of Dampsole.
Gwee? Gweeeeee!
Gah! Damned fiend got me in the leg... I can barely stand, let alone move. Is this the end for me?
The amaro eyes the wounded soldier with a gaze that could almost be described as concerned. This must be the sentry who was separated from his mount.
Gweeeeee! Gweeeeee!
The amaro eyes you with an expectant gaze. You sense it is hoping that you will tend to the man's wounds.
Gweeeeee! Gweeeeee!
The amaro eyes you with an expectant gaze. You sense it is hoping that you will tend to the man's wounds.
Thank you, friend! When the beast knocked me from my mount, I thought it was the end of me for sure! But however did you know where to look?
My mount led you to me? You don't say!
I owe you an apology, little fellow... Here I thought you ran off in fear of my foe, but it turns out you were looking for help the whole time. Can you forgive me for doubting you?
Gwee!
And with that, I'd best head back to the Imperative and let everyone know I'm all right. Thank you, my friend. You saved my life today.
Ah, there you are. I was hoping that you'd return so I could properly express my gratitude. You'll be happy to know─as I would─that my man has safely returned to the Imperative.
Those amaro can be stubborn brutes at times, but times like this make a man appreciate what loyal companions they truly are. I'd say this one's earned himself some extra feed for dinner today!
